intro: Ribes roezlii var. cruentum, commonly known as the crimson currant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Grossulariaceae. It is characterized by its red to purple berries, which are typically eaten by birds and small mammals. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of the Himalayas. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and showy flowers that bloom in early summer.
